titles.title: Kake Tribal Corporation Land Exchange Act
Kake Tribal Corporation Land Exchange Act
To authorize an exchange of property between the Kake Tribal Corporation and the Sealaska Corporation and the United States.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Executive Comment Requested from USDA, Interior.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 105-783.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 444.

bill.summary: 10/6/1998--Reported to House amended. Kake Tribal Corporation Land Exchange Act - Amends the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act to direct the Secretary of Agriculture to transfer the surface estate of specified property to the Kake Tribal Corporation and the subsurface estate of such property to the Sealaksa Corporation in exchange for the transfer of the surface and subsurface estates of specified property owned by such Corporations to the United States.
